Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} As a result, the pair faced each other in a [[Professional wrestling match types#No Count-Out match|no countout]], [[Professional wrestling match types#No Disqualification match|no disqualification]], [[Professional wrestling match types#Loser Leaves Town match|loser leaves WWE]] match at [[Extreme Rules (2011)|Extreme Rules]] on 1 May, which Layla won.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2011/05/01/18090841.html|title=Extreme Rules: Championship make-over edition|date=1 May 2011|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=2 May 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Layla announced that she had suffered a knee injury at Extreme Rules on ''SmackDown'' on 13 May, and was interrupted and attacked by [[Kia Stevens|Kharma]] to write her off television.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/05/13/18147296.html|title=Smackdown: Old standards in Music City|date=13 May 2011|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=10 December 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Later that month, it was confirmed that Layla had [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#Legit|legitimately]] torn both her [[Anterior cruciate ligament|Anterior cruciate]] and [[Medial collateral ligament]]s, and required surgery.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1306380589|title=WWE Diva scheduled for surgery|date=25 May 2011|last=Gerweck|first=Steve|accessdate=10 December 2011|publisher=WrestleView}} === Divas Champion and retirement (2012–2015) === Layla made her in-ring return at a [[Florida Championship Wrestling]] event on 22 March 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/quicknews/article_59424.shtml|title=Layla returns to in-ring action|date=23 May 2012|accessdate=8 April 2012|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} She made her return to the main WWE roster at the [[Extreme Rules (2012)|Extreme Rules]] pay-per-view on 29 April, replacing Beth Phoenix, who was not medically cleared to compete, in a match for the [[WWE Divas Championship]]. Despite interference from [[The Bella Twins|Brie Bella]], Layla defeated [[The Bella Twins|Nikki Bella]] to win the WWE Divas Championship for the first time.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2012/04/29/19694541.html|title=Bloodied Cena shocks Lesnar to cap off outstanding Extreme Rules|date=29 April 2012|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=30 April 2012|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Her victory made her the first ''Diva Search'' winner to won both the Divas and the Women's championship. The following night on ''Raw'', she successfully defended the championship against both Nikki and Brie in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Basic non-elimination matches|triple threat match]], and retained twice against Beth Phoenix at the [[Over the Limit (2012)|Over the Limit]] and [[No Way Out (2012)|No Way Out]] pay-per-views in May and June respectively.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/05/01/19700256.html|title=Raw: Triple H reads the riot act to Lesnar, but Laurinaitis gets the last laugh in Dayton|date=1 May 2012|last=Tylwalk|first=Nick|accessdate=1 May 2012|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_61620.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Over The Limit PPV Report 5/20: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of live PPV – Cena-Johnny, Punk-Bryan|date=20 May 2012|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=21 May 2012|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/06/17/19888861.html|title=No Way Out: End of another era|date=17 June 2012|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=21 June 2012|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the 20 August episode of ''Raw'', [[Kaitlyn (wrestler)|Kaitlyn]] won a [[Professional wrestling battle royal|battle royal]] to become the number one contender to Layla's Divas Championship.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/08/21/20123046.html|title=Raw: The king is dead, long live the king|date=21 August 2012|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} At [[Night of Champions (2012)|Night of Champions]], Kaitlyn was removed from the championship match following a storyline injury and replaced with Eve Torres. Torres defeated Layla to win the championship.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/09/17/20204671.html|title=Night of Champions: Hustle, loyalty, and yes, respect|date=17 September 2012|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Layla defeated Torres in a non-title match on ''[[WWE Superstars|Superstars]]'' to earn a title match.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwsuperstarsreport/article_65600.shtml|title=James's WWE Superstars Results 9/27: Kofi vs. Ziggler in re-match from Monday's Raw, Divas champ in action, DiBiase|date=1 October 2012|last=James|first=Justin|accessdate=1 September 2013|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} She unsuccessfully challenged for the championship on 15 October, and failed again to regain the championship in a three-way match at [[Hell in a Cell (2012)|Hell in a Cell]], which also involved Kaitlyn.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/10/16/20285416.html|title=Raw: Punk gets his big decision made for him in Nashville|date=16 October 2012|last=Tylwalk|first=Nick|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/10/29/20314921.html|title=Punk gets Shell Shocked but escapes with his gold at Hell in a Cell |date=29 October 2013|last1=Plummer|first1=Dale|last2=Tylwalk|first2=Nick|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On 12 November, on ''Raw'', Layla was defeated by Kaitlyn in a number one contenders match for the championship.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2012/11/13/20351961.html|title=Raw: The Survivor Series picture gets cleared up in Columbus|date=13 November 2012|last=Tylwalk|first=Nick|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On 16 December at the [[TLC: Tables, Ladders & Chairs (2012)|Tables, Ladders & Chairs]] pay-per-view, Layla competed in a number one contender's "Santa's Little Helpers" battle royal to face Torres for the championship, but was unsuccessful in winning the match.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_67280.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE TLC PPV Results 12/16: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of final 2012 PPV – Cena vs. Ziggler main event, Shield makes a statement|date=16 December 2012|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=16 December 2012|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} In early 2013, Layla briefly developed a feud with [[Tamina Snuka]], losing to her in singles matches before defeating her in a tag team match.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/01/05/20474696.html|title=Smackdown: Showcasing that pesky second W in WWE|date=5 January 2013|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/02/16/20584276.html|title=Smackdown: Signs, signs, everywhere are (Wrestlemania) signs|date=16 February 2013|last=Hillhouse|first=Dave|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/02/22/20601966.html|title=Smackdown!: Orton wants Elimination Chamber revenge against Swagger|date=22 February 2013|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} As part of the feud, Layla allied herself with Kaitlyn, and began accompanying her to ringside.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/03/08/20640976.html|title=Smackdown! The Shield can't serve justice to The Big Show|date=8 March 2013|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the 2 August episode of ''SmackDown'', Layla became a [[Heel (professional wrestling)|villainess]] when she stopped Kaitlyn from spearing [[AJ Lee]], costing Kaitlyn both the match and the Divas Championship, and left with AJ.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/08/02/21020696.html|title=Smackdown!: Del Rio's pick for SummerSlam overruled|date=2 August 2013|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Layla went on to defeat Kaitlyn in singles competition and in a tag team match with AJ as her partner.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/08/06/21025766.html|title=Raw: Cena, Bryan and Orton are uneasy allies in Green Bay|date=6 August 2013|last=Tylwalk|first=Nick|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2013/08/16/21053671.html|title=Smackdown!: Daniel Bryan sees a revolving door of referees|date=16 August 2013|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=1 September 2013|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} [[File:Layla, Fandango, Rae.jpg|thumb|left|alt=A brunette Caucasian woman and dark-haired Caucasian man in a wrestling ring, pointing and yelling at a blonde Caucasian woman with her back to the camera.|Layla and [[Fandango (wrestler)|Fandango]] being confronted by [[Summer Rae]] (right) on 19 May]] In late 2013, Layla took a hiatus from WWE due to ongoing personal issues.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-news/46802-update-on-the-wwe-status-of-layla-and-richie-steamboat|title=Update on the WWE status of Layla and Richie Steamboat|date=16 February 2014|last=Martin|first=Adam|accessdate=20 February 2014|publisher=WrestleView}} She returned at a [[house show|non-televised event]] on 14 March 2014, and made her television return the following week on an episode of ''[[WWE Main Event|Main Event]]'', where she and [[Alicia Fox]] lost to [[The Funkadactyls]] ([[Naomi Knight|Naomi]] and [[Cameron Lynn|Cameron]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-news/47363-layla-returns-to-the-ring-for-wwe-at-live-event|title=Layla returns to the ring for WWE at live event|date=15 March 2014|last=Martin|first=Adam|accessdate=18 March 2014|publisher=WrestleView}}{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwsuperstarsreport/article_77097.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Main Event Results 3/18: In-person coverage of Undertaker's Main Event debut on WWE Network, more|date=18 March 2014|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=19 March 2014|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} Layla participated in the Divas Invitational match for the WWE Divas Championship at [[WrestleMania XXX]] which was won by AJ.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2014/04/06/21585306.html|title=WrestleMania XXX brings the beginning and end of eras|date=6 April 2014|last=Howell|first=Nolan|accessdate=9 April 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} The following week, she replaced [[Summer Rae]] as [[Fandango (wrestler)|Fandango]]'s dancer and valet, and quickly became embroiled in a feud with [[Emma (wrestler)|Emma]] and Santino Marella.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-news/47831-spoilers-wwe-smackdown-taping-results-for-april-11|title=Spoilers: WWE Smackdown taping results for April 11|date=8 April 2014|last=Martin|first=Adam|accessdate=9 April 2014|publisher=WrestleView}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2014/04/14/21603951.html|title=Raw: Celebrating Ultimate Warrior and witnessing a powerful reunion|date=14 April 2014|last=Tylwalk|first=Nick|accessdate=26 April 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2014/04/22/21618721.html|title=Raw: Bryan beatdown in Baltimore, IC finals set|date=22 April 2014|last=Asher|first=Matthew|accessdate=26 April 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} In May, Layla entered a tournament to determine the new [[NXT Women's Championship|NXT Women's Champion]], but lost to Natalya in the first round.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwenxtreport/article_78123.shtml|title=James's WWE NXT Report 5/1 – Week 96: Neville defends NXT Title, Women's tournament begins, more; Overall Reax|date=1 May 2014|last=James|first=Justin|accessdate=7 June 2014|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} Rae returned on 19 May, attacking Layla.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2014/05/20/21682641.html|title=Raw: Bray Wyatt has the whole world in his hands – including London|date=20 May 2014|last=Tylwalk|first=Nick|accessdate=21 May 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Competing over Fandango's affections, Layla and Rae repeatedly attacked each other, prompting a match at [[Money in the Bank (2014)|Money in the Bank]] with Fandango as the [[Referee (professional wrestling)#Special referees|special guest referee]]; Layla won the match.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2014/06/25/21763801.html|title=Main Event: Reigns makes a point before Money in the Bank|date=25 June 2014|last=Howell|first=Nolan|accessdate=30 June 2014|work=Slam Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2014/06/29/21774111.html|title=Cena takes authority of the WWE title at Money in the Bank|date=29 June 2014|last=Howell|first=Nolan|accessdate=30 June 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} During a rematch in July on ''SmackDown'', Layla and Rae attacked Fandango, before dancing with each other.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2014/07/11/21800746.html|title=Smackdown!: Rusev and Reigns face off in Ottawa|date=11 July 2014|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=14 July 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Starting at [[Battleground (2014)|Battleground]], the pair formed an alliance, distracting Fandango during his matches and causing him to lose.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_79700.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Battleground PPV Report 7/20 (Pre-Show): Fandango vs. Rose, Cameron vs. Naomi, more|date=20 July 2014|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=21 July 2014|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}}{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_79722.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw Results 7/21: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw – Battleground fall-out|date=21 July 2014|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=21 July 2014|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} In their first match as a team, Layla and Rae, now calling themselves the Slayers, lost to [[Britani Knight|Paige]] and AJ Lee on the 18 July episode of ''SmackDown''.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_79687.shtml|title=Parks's WWE SmackDown Report 7/18: Complete coverage of Friday night show, including Chris Jericho vs. Luke Harper, Kane vs. Dean Ambrose|date=18 July 2014|last=Parks|first=Greg|accessdate=19 July 2014|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} The Slayers won their first match as a team on ''Main Event'' on 2 September, where they defeated [[Rosa Mendes]] and Natalya.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwsuperstarsreport/article_80548.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Main Event Results 9/2: Ziggler vs. Miz's stand-in, Goldust & Stardust, toilet scrubbing, more|date=2 September 2014|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=13 September 2014|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} The Slayers were part of Team Paige at [[Survivor Series (2014)|Survivor Series]] in November, but both were eliminated and their team lost the match.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2014/11/24/22091341.html|title=WWE Survivor Series: The Authority feels the Sting of defeat|date=24 November 2014|last=Kapur|first=Bob|accessdate=24 November 2014|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} In January 2015, El underwent surgery for unknown reasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-news/52707-wwe-diva-injured-and-pulled-from-all-live-events|title=WWE Diva injured and pulled from all live events|date=23 January 2015|last=Martin|first=Adam|accessdate=24 January 2015|publisher=WrestleView}} Layla returned on the 14 April episode of ''Main Event'', where she defeated Emma in a singles match.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/wwe-news/54029-spoilers-4-14-wwe-main-event-tapings-from-london|title=SPOILERS: 4/14 WWE MAIN EVENT TAPINGS FROM LONDON|author=Namako, Jason|website=WrestleView|date=14 April 2015|accessdate=18 April 2015}} On the 13 June episode of ''[[WWE Superstars]]'', Layla lost to Paige in what would be her final televised match. On 29 July, WWE announced that Layla had decided to retire from professional wrestling, confirming her release from the company.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/layla-retires-from-wwe|title=Layla retires from WWE|author=Tello, Craig|website=[[WWE]]|date=29 July 2015|accessdate=3 August 2015}} == Modelling career == Since winning the Diva Search contest El has also done some [[Model (person)|modelling]] work. She has been featured in the magazines ''[[King (magazine)|King]]'', ''[[Smooth (magazine)|Smooth]]'', and was the cover-girl for the first issue of ''Liquid''.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/overtheropes/news/laylasmooth|title=Layla gets 'Smooth' and sexy|last=Medalis|first=Kara A.|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=15 August 2007}}{{cite web|url=http://king-mag.com/online/?p=2792|title=Layla El – King Magazine|accessdate=15 April 2007|work=[[King (magazine)|King]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/archive/laylaliquid|title=Layla is LIQUID's premiere cover girl|first=Kara A.|last=Medalis|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|accessdate=5 December 2006}} She also posed for ''[[FHM]]'' with the other members of Extreme Exposé.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/divas/divadish/divadish0810|last2=Tello|first2=Craig|last3=Zeigler|first3=Zack|first1=Kara A.|last1=Medalis|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|title=Diva Dish: FHM goes Extreme|accessdate=10 August 2007}} Layla, along with [[Beth Phoenix]] and [[Candice Michelle]], appeared in the February 2009 issue of ''[[Flex (magazine)|Flex Magazine]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/sports/wrestling/story/1137153.html|title=WWE diva, former Heat dancer Layla returning to Miami; Tye Dye Guy as Raw guest GM in Orlando?|date=11 July 2009|last=Varsallone|first=Jim|accessdate=12 July 2009|publisher=[[The Miami Herald]]|archivedate=12 July 2009|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5iCkIntOy?url=http://www.miamiherald.com/sports/wrestling/story/1137153.html|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/overtheropes/news/divasflex|title=Raw Divas 'Flex' some muscle|date=11 January 2009|last=Medalis|first=Kara A.|accessdate=12 July 2009|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} == Other media == In April 2007, El and several other WWE Divas appeared in the music video for "Throw It On Me" by [[Timbaland]] and [[The Hives]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/news/archive/4563070|first=Kara A.|last=Medalis|title=The Sexiest Women in L.A.|accessdate=20 April 2007|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} During the week of 5 November 2007, she appeared on five episodes of ''[[Family Feud]]'' with other WWE wrestlers. On 6 February 2008 she appeared on ''[[Project Runway]]'' with several WWE Divas as part of the week's challenge.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/divas/divadish/divadish0125?cid=WWEADP-83|title=Diva Dish: 'Runway' Divas|accessdate=10 February 2008|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|first1=Kara A.|last1=Medalis|last2=Zeigler|first2=Zack}} El also appeared on the 13 April 2008 episode of ''[[Celebrity Fit Club (U.S. TV series)#Season Six - 2008|Celebrity Fit Club Boot Camp]]'' as a trainer. She appeared as a guest judge on an episode of ''[[Cupcake Wars]]'' alongside Alicia Fox.{{cite web|url=https://www.foodnetwork.com/shows/cupcake-wars/episodes/wwe-summerslam|title=WWE SummerSlam (season 9, episode 3)|accessdate=19 April 2018|publisher=[[Food Network]]}} In 2012, she ranked number 95 in ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'''s [[Maxim (magazine)#Maxim Hot 100|Hot 100]].{{cite web|title=Divas sizzle on Maxim's Hot 100|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/overtheropes/divas-maxim-hot-100-2012|date=22 May 2012|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=22 May 2012}}{{cite web|title=95 Layla El|url=http://www.maxim.com/slideshow/hot-100/43451?slide=5#|work=[[Maxim (magazine)|Mazxim]]|accessdate=11 November 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131112012114/http://www.maxim.com/slideshow/hot-100/43451?slide=5|archivedate=12 November 2013|df=dmy-all}} == Personal life == El has previously lived in [[Miami]], [[Florida]], and [[Los Angeles]], [[California]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/divas/divadish/divadish1114|title=Diva Dish: Divas thrill Europe|date=14 November 2008|last=Medalis|first=Kara A.|accessdate=14 August 2010|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]}} El's mother died in August 2008 at the age of 48 due to [[breast cancer]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/divas/divadish/divadish1010|title=Diva Dish: Neidhart family reunion|date=10 October 2008|last=Medalis|first=Kara A.|accessdate=14 August 2010|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090601234751/http://www.wwe.com/superstars/divas/divadish/divadish1010|archivedate=1 June 2009}} El's mother had battled it three times in two decades. In October 2012, El appeared in a commercial from the WWE and [[Susan G. Komen for the Cure]] to promote awareness for finding a cure for breast cancer.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/layla-talks-about-her-mothers-struggle-with-breast-cancer-26060156|title=Layla talk about her mother's struggle with breast cancer|publisher=[[WWE]]|access-date=18 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150218115437/http://www.wwe.com/videos/layla-talks-about-her-mothers-struggle-with-breast-cancer-26060156|archive-date=18 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} El incorporated [[Infinity symbol|infinity]] symbols on her wrestling attire as a tribute to her mother.{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=t3HMBgAAQBAJ&pg=PT121&lpg=PT121&dq=layla+infinity+symbol+wwe&source=bl&ots=qGxobhvAY-&sig=R7zy58BiKZQLHuF7yrdUNhtpvlk&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CCsQ6AEwA2oVChMIg4SLjsCVxwIVpWjbCh0bPg1r#v=onepage&q=layla%20infinity%20symbol%20wwe&f=false|title=WWE Ultimate Superstar Guide|author=Pantaleo, Steve|publisher=[[WWE]]|accessdate=6 August 2015}} On 28 July 2015, El announced her engagement to [[Ricky Ortiz|Richard Young]],{{cite web | url=https://twitter.com/mslayel/status/625917087756627968|title=Aawwwww who woulda thought .... @iamrichyoung2 richandlay #love #engagement #future #young 💖💕|publisher=[[Twitter]]|date=28 July 2015|accessdate=28 July 2015|author=El, Layla}} and the two were married on 27 November.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/mslayel/status/681773806256455680|title=Layla Young on Twitter|publisher=[[Twitter]]|date=29 December 2015|accessdate=29 December 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/layla-ricky-ortiz-married-28355271|title=Former WWE Diva and Superstar tie the knot|publisher=[[WWE]]|date=11 December 2015|accessdate=29 December 2015}} == Filmography == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! |based_on = ''Shake It, ET'' by Zifeng Diuzi |director =Zhao Xiaoxi, Zhao Xiaoou (Season 1)
Wang Yan, Wang Xiaoying (Season 2) |starring =Zheng Yecheng
[[An Yuexi]] |opentheme = |endtheme = |composer = |country = China |language = Mandarin |num_episodes = 25 (Season 1)
26 (Season 2) |producer =Tang Lijun (Season 1–2)
Yuan Yumei (Season 1)
Li Yongjie (Season 2) |location = [[Xiangshan County, Zhejiang|Xiangshan]]
[[Hengdian World Studios]] |cinematography = |editor = |camera = |runtime = 40 mins |company = [[Youku]]
New iPicture |distributor = |channel = [[Youku]] (Season 1)
[[Mango TV]] (Season 2) |picture_format = |audio_format = |first_aired = {{start date|2017|08|07|df=y}} |last_aired = |preceded_by = |followed_by = |related = |website = |production_website = }} '''''Let's Shake It''''' ([[Chinese language|Chinese]]: 颤抖吧, 阿部!) is a 2017 Chinese web series starring Zheng Yecheng and [[An Yuexi]]. It follows the story of an alien, Abu, who assumes the identity of Tang Qingye after accidentally landing on Earth, and her subsequent involvement with Tang Qingfeng.{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/16/1228/09/C9C6660700038FO9.html|title=摸底《颤抖吧，阿部》剧组 郑业成安悦溪变萌喵|website=Netease|date=|language=zh}} The series aired on [[Youku]] on 7 August 2017. The series was a commercial success, with a total of 2 billion views online and a rating of 7.8 on [[Douban]].{{cite web|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20170908/42973815_0.shtml|title=爆款黑马《颤抖吧，阿部》收官 赵氏兄弟全面出击|website=ifeng|date=|language=zh}} Its popularity was said to be due to its light-heartened and humorous content, as well as its inclusion of a mixture of unique elements like [[Extraterrestrial life in fiction|aliens]], [[time-travel]] and inter-racial relationships.{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/17/0811/17/CRITMKDE00038793.html|title=《颤抖吧阿部》破亿 网友：此剧有毒笑到停不下来|website=Netease|date=|language=zh}}{{cite web|url=http://paper.stardaily.com.cn/html/2017-08/29/content_176535.htm|title=优酷超级网剧《颤抖吧，阿部》杀青 超前题材打破次元壁|website=Star Daily|language=zh}} The series was also praised for its use of high-quality special effects.{{cite web|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20170905/42972915_0.shtml|title=这年头还有不辣眼的特效？看《颤抖吧阿部》如何做到|website=ifeng|language=zh}} The second season, ''Trouble on Planet Duo'' airs on [[Mango TV]] on September 27 2018.{{cite web|url=http://ent.163.com/18/0917/12/DRTG7ACA000380EN.html?baike|title=《颤抖吧阿部2》定档 郑业成安悦溪展开全新冒险之旅|website=Netease|language=zh}} ==Synopsis== ===Season 1=== During the reign of [[Emperor Daizong of Tang]], there is unrest on the border. The Emperor awards the sixth prince, Li Yi by making him the Crown Prince and betrothing Tang Qingye to him. However, Lady Tang, upset that the daughter of a concubine is to become the Crown Princess, has Qingye replaced by her own daughter, Tang Qingyun, and sends assassins after Qingye. Simultaneously, Abu Chacha of Planet Duo, who lands on Earth, is forced to assume the identity of Tang Qingye, thus beginning her fated love-hate relationship with Tang Qingfeng. ===Season 2=== After Tang Qingfeng wakes up, he finds out he was captured by The Time Keepers for messing up timelines. Abu, Tang Qingfeng, and Duo Meow tries to go back to the Tang dynasty to make things right again, but accidentally return to the Sui dynasty instead. With the help of the young Tang father, they must now try to fix history or the Tang dynasty will never exist. ==Cast== ===Main=== *Zheng Yecheng as Tang Qingfeng :The eldest son of Tang Jizhong and Lady Tang. As [[Chang'an]]'s leading talent, Qingfeng is handsome and reliable. Despite Qingye's sudden change in temperament, he cannot bear to treat her harshly. He often finds Abu's strange actions dumbfounding. *[[An Yuexi]] as Abu Chacha / Tang Qingye :Abu Chacha: A lively alien who disrupted the order of the universe. In order to adapt to life on Earth, she is caught up in many incidents, becoming frenemies with Qingfeng in the process. :Qingye: The second daughter of Tang Jizhong, by his concubine. ===Season 1=== ====Aliens==== *Wang Yanyang as '''Duo Miaomiao'''. Captain of Planet Duo's star fleet. Because of the failure of his aircraft, he is forced to land on Earth. He fell for Xiao Ruyi in the process of solving crimes with her. *Zhu Ziyan as Jile. Alien Elder. ====Imperial Family==== *Zhao Dongze as '''Li Yi'''. The Crown Prince. He deceitfully hides his true intentions due to a tragic childhood in the palace. In order to gain the throne, he does not hesitate to collude with the enemy and reignite the war on the border. *Chen Yisha as the Empress. *Gao Hai as Li Fu. The Prince of Qi, Li Yi's elder brother. ====Tang Family==== *Chen Chen as '''Tang Qingyun'''. The eldest daughter of Tang Jizhong, by Lady Tang. Beneath her gentle facade is someone full of tenacity. She has loved Li Yi since childhood. *Yang Taoge as '''Dabao'''. Tang Qingfeng's lieutenant. *Wang Gang as Tang Jizhong. General. *Tian Miao as Lady Tang. Tang Jizhong's wife. *Huang Yuecheng as Xiang'er. Tang Qingye's personal maid. ====Xiao Family==== *Xu Hao as '''Xiao Ruyi'''. The Right General of the Jinwu Guard. Beneath her unsmiling facade is someone longing for affection. *Wu Hao as Xiao Zhihe. Xiao Ruyi's younger brother. ===Season 2=== *Xu Jiawei as Duo Miaomiao *Xu Muchan as Duo Xingxing *Ning Xiaohua as Judge *Lu Feng as Immortal *Wu Peirou as Xiao Ba ==Soundtrack== {{tracklist | collapsed = | headline = | extra_column = Singer | total_length = | all_writing = | all_lyrics = | all_music = | title1 = Loving You is Not Bad (爱你也不差) | note1 = Opening theme song | writer1 = | lyrics1 = Li Yang | music1 = [[Mak Chun Hung]] | extra1 = Wu Yanqing | length1 = | title2 = Only Belong to Love (专属爱情) | note2 = Ending theme song | writer2 = | lyrics2 = Li Ruotian | music2 = Ma Ping | extra2 = Zheng Yecheng & [[An Yuexi]] | length2 = | title3 = Waiting For You | writer3 = | lyrics3 = Tang Dou | music3 =ZigZag Note | extra3 = Wang Xiaomin | title4 = Waiting For Love (等待爱) | writer4 = | lyrics4 = Ting Hai | music4 =Qian Lei | extra4 = Ning Hengyu | title5 = Shaking (颤抖) | writer5 = | lyrics5 = Lin Qiao | music5 = Qian Dachuan | extra5 =Mao Fangyuan | title6 = Say You Love Me (说你爱我) | writer6 = | lyrics6 = Qian Lijing | music6 = [[Mak Chun Hung]] | extra6 =Wu Yanshan | title7 = Light Wind Arrived (清风来过) | writer7 = | lyrics7 = Gong Shujun | music7 = Yi Rui | extra7 =Gong Shujun & Ding Shaohua | title8 = Plastic Surgery Monster (整容怪) | writer8 = | lyrics8 = Tang Dou | music8 = M80 | extra8 =Shanghai Rap }} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== [[Category:Television programs based on Chinese novels]] [[Category:2017 Chinese television series debuts]] [[Category:Chinese web series]] [[Category:Chinese romantic comedy television series]] [[Category:Chinese science fiction television series]] [[Category:Youku web series]] [[Category:2017 web series debuts]]

page.title: List of Australian Academy Award winners and nominees

revision.comment: copy edit with [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser/General_fixes|General fixes]]; url trimming of identifying info per[[WP:LINKSTOAVOID]] and [[Template:Citation_Style_documentation#url|Citation Style]], replaced: As of 2016 → {{as of|2016||}}
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Use Australian English|date=July 2015}} [[File:Catherine Martin (Australian designer).jpg|right|thumb|200px|[[Catherine Martin (designer)|Catherine Martin]] has won four Academy Awards, more than any other Australian. She has received six nominations in the [[Academy Award for Best Costume Design|Best Costume Design]] and [[Academy Award for Best Production Design|Best Production Design]] categories.]] This list details [[Australian]] people working in the [[film industry]] who have been nominated for, or won, [[Academy Award]]s (also known as Oscars). These awards honour outstanding achievements in theatrically released motion pictures and were first presented by the [[United States]] [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] (AMPAS) in 1929. {{as of|2016}}, a total of 43 awards from 154 nominations have been won by Australians. Additionally, awards for Scientific and Engineering achievements have been given to Australians four times. Art director and costume designer [[Catherine Martin (designer)|Catherine Martin]] has received more awards than any other Australian with four wins from six nominations in the [[Academy Award for Best Costume Design|Best Costume Design]] and [[Academy Award for Best Production Design|Best Production Design]] categories. [[Cate Blanchett]] is the most nominated individual in this list with seven nominations, which resulted in a win for [[Academy Award for Best Actress|Best Leading Actress]] and [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]]. [[Peter Weir]] has received five nominations in the [[Academy Award for Best Picture|Best Picture]], [[Academy Award for Best Director|Best Director]] and [[Academy Award for Best Writing (Original Screenplay)|Best Original Screenplay]] categories without a win. [[May Robson]] was the first Australian-born person to receive an Oscar nomination for [[Academy Award for Best Actress|Best Actress]] in [[6th Academy Awards|1933]] for ''[[Lady for a Day]]''. In [[15th Academy Awards|1942]], [[Ken G. Hall]] became the first Australian to win an Academy Award for his documentary ''[[Kokoda Front Line!]]'' in the [[Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature|Best Documentary]] category. [[Suzanne Baker]] was the first Australian woman to win an Oscar, which was given to her in [[49th Academy Awards|1977]] for [[Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film|Best Animated Short]] for ''Leisure''. Cate Blanchett was the first Australian actor to win more than one award in the acting categories. [[Peter Finch]] was the first actor to be awarded an Oscar [[List of posthumous Academy Award winners and nominees|posthumously]], winning the [[Academy Award for Best Actor]] for his performance in ''[[Network (1976 film)|Network]]'' in [[49th Academy Awards|1976]]. The only other acting Oscar awarded posthumously was to fellow Australian [[Heath Ledger]] 32 years later when his performance in ''[[The Dark Knight (film)|The Dark Knight]]'' earned him the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]] in [[81st Academy Awards|2008]]. Australians have been nominated at least once in all categories. The Oscar for Best Costume Design has been the most successful category for Australians with seven wins from 17 nominations. The Academy Awards for [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]], [[Academy Award for Best Original Score|Best Original Score]], and the [[Academy Award for Best Documentary (Short Subject)|Best Documentary (Short Subject)]] are the only categories in this list where Australians have been nominated without winning. ==Nominees and winners== In the following tables, the years correspond to the year in which the films were released; the Academy Award ceremony is held the following year. ==Production== [[File:Baz Luhrmann.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[Baz Luhrmann]] was co-nominated for Best Picture in 2001 for ''[[Moulin Rouge!]]'' (2001).|alt=A male with grey hair is seen standing in front of a white wall with black text. He is wearing a white jacket on top of a white shirt with a black bow tie shirt.]] [[File:George Miller - Happy Feet 2.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[George Miller (director)|George Miller]] won the Oscar for Best Animated Feature in 2006 for ''[[Happy Feet]]'' (2006).|alt=A male with grey hair and round black-rimmed glasses is seen standing in front of a blue and white wall. He is wearing a black jacket on top of a white open collared shirt and is smiling.]] [[File:Emile Sherman (cropped).jpg|thumb|125px|Emile Sherman was the co-recipient of Best Picture for ''[[The King's Speech]]'' (2010).]] [[File:Adam Elliot, AACTA, 2.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[Adam Elliot]] won Best Animated Short Film for ''[[Harvie Krumpet]]'' (2003).|alt=]] [[File:Tan, Shaun (WFA).jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[Shaun Tan]]'s ''[[The Lost Thing]]'' (2011) won the Oscar for Best Animated Short film.|alt=]] ===Best Picture=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- style="background:#bfd7ff;" | colspan="6" style="text-align:center;"| '''[[Academy Award for Best Picture]]''' |- style="background:#ebf5ff;" ! style="width:75px;"|'''Year''' ! style="width:200px;"|'''Producer(s)''' ! style="width:350px;"|'''Film''' ! style="width:75px;"|'''Status''' ! style="width:500px;"|'''Notes''' !width="3"|'''Ref(s)''' |- | [[1993 in film|1993]]
([[66th Academy Awards|66th]]) | [[Jan Chapman]] | ''[[The Piano]]'' | {{nom}} | | style="text-align: center"| {{cite web |title=Curator's notes: The Piano (1993) |publisher=[[National Film and Sound Archive]] (NFSA) | url=http://aso.gov.au/titles/features/the-piano/notes/| accessdate=16 January 2013}} |- | rowspan=2|[[1995 in film|1995]]

[[Josh Lawson]] | ''[[The Eleven O'Clock]]'' | {{nom}} | | style="text-align: center" | |} ==Performance== [[File:May Robson in Broadway to Hollywood trailer.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[May Robson]] was the first Australian-born person to be nominated for an Oscar, receiving a nomination for Best Actress for ''[[Lady for a Day]]'' (1933).|alt=]] [[File:Nicole Kidman Cannes 2017 2.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[Nicole Kidman]] has won one out of four acting Oscars, winning Best Actress for ''[[The Hours (film)|The Hours]]'' (2002).|alt=]] [[File:Cate Blanchett Cannes 2015.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[Cate Blanchett]] has been nominated for seven Oscars, more than any other Australian. She won one each for Best Supporting Actress and Best Actress for ''[[The Aviator (2004 film)|The Aviator]]'' (2004) and ''[[Blue Jasmine]]'' (2013), respectively.]] [[File:Peter Finch 2.jpg|right|thumb|125px|[[Peter Finch]] was the first actor to receive a [[List of posthumous Academy Award winners and nominees|posthumous]] Academy Award for Best Actor for ''[[Network (1976 film)|Network]]'' (1976).|alt=]] [[File:GeoffreyRushTIFFSept2011.jpg|thumb|right|125px|[[Geoffrey Rush]] has been nominated twice in both acting categories, winning once for Best Actor for ''[[Shine (film)|Shine]]'' (1996).]] [[File:Russell Crowe - Flickr - Eva Rinaldi Celebrity and Live Music Photographer (2).jpg|thumb|right|125px|[[Russell Crowe]] won once from three nominations for Best Actor, winning for ''[[Gladiator (2000 film)|Gladiator]]'' (2000).]] [[File:Heath Ledger (Berlin Film Festival 2006) revised.jpg|thumb|right|125px|Like Finch, [[Heath Ledger]] received a posthumous Oscar. He won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for ''[[The Dark Knight (film)|The Dark Knight]]'' (2008).|alt=A close-up image of a blond haired man wearing a grey and orange sweater.]] ===Best Actress=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- style="background:#bfd7ff;" | colspan="6" style="text-align:center;"| '''[[Academy Award for Best Actress]]''' |- style="background:#ebf5ff;" ! style="width:75px;"|'''Year''' ! style="width:200px;"|'''Name''' ! style="width:350px;"|'''Film''' ! style="width:75px;"|'''Status''' ! style="width:500px;"|'''Notes''' !width="3"|'''Ref(s)''' |- | style="text-align: center"| [[1932 in film|1932]]/[[1933 in film|33]]

[[80th Academy Awards|(80th)]] | ''[[I'm Not There]]'' | {{nom}} | Blanchett became the first Australian, and the eleventh overall performer, to receive [[List of actors nominated for two Academy Awards in the same year|double acting nominations in the same year]] (the other for Best Actress for ''Elizabeth: The Golden Age'').{{cite news|last1=Karger|first1=Dave|title=The unpredictable 2008 Oscars|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2008/01/25/unpredictable-2008-oscars|accessdate=25 January 2017|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=25 January 2008}}{{cite news | url=http://www.nationalpost.com/opinion/columnists/story.html?id=26713113-e72b-4e54-b272-d60ee0b72e75&p=1 | title=A little help from his friends | work=[[National Post]] | accessdate=25 January 2017}} This performance also made her one of three women to have ever been nominated for a female acting Oscar for portraying a man. | style="text-align: center"| {{Cite web|url=http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2008|title=The 80th Academy Awards (2008) Nominees and Winners|accessdate=25 January 2017|publisher=Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS)}} |- | style="text-align: center"| [[2010 in film|2010]]

([[66th Academy Awards|66th]]) | [[Jane Campion]] | ''[[The Piano]]'' | {{won}} | Campion was born in New Zealand but resides in Australia.{{cite web |title=Campion, Jane: Holy Smoke |publisher=Urban Cinefile | url=http://www.urbancinefile.com.au/home/view.asp?a=3108 |first=Diana |last =Simmonds| accessdate=15 January 2013}} | style="text-align: center"| {{cite news |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=10628130 |title=Campion makes India sex complaint |first= |last =Staff |work=[[The New Zealand Herald]] |accessdate=15 January 2013|date=24 February 2010}} |- | style="text-align: center"| [[1996 in film|1996]]

[[Jan Sardi]] | ''[[Shine (film)|Shine]]'' | {{nom}} | Hicks was born in Uganda but moved to Australia at age 14.{{cite web |title=Hicks, Scott 1953- |publisher=SA Memory ([[State Library of South Australia]]) | url=http://www.samemory.sa.gov.au/site/page.cfm?u=438&c=2427| accessdate=26 January 2017}} | style="text-align: center"| |} ==Scientific and Engineering== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- style="background:#bfd7ff;" | colspan="6" style="text-align:center;"| '''[[Academy Scientific and Technical Award]]''' |- style="background:#ebf5ff;" ! style="width:75px;"|'''Year''' ! style="width:200px;"|'''Name''' ! style="width:350px;"|'''Field''' ! style="width:75px;"|'''Status''' ! style="width:500px;"|'''Notes''' !width="3"|'''Ref(s)''' |- | style="text-align: center"| [[1997 in film|1997]]
([[70th Academy Awards|70th]]) | [[Jim Frazier (inventor)|Jim Frazier]] | Photography | {{won}} | Frazier was awarded for the concept. His fellow recipients Iain Neil, Rick Gelbard were involved in the design and development of the [[Frazier lens|Panavision/Frazier Lens System]] for motion picture photography. | style="text-align: center"| {{cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/05/13/1052591785954.html|title=The cameraman and the piranhas|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|date=14 May 2003|accessdate=26 January 2017}} |- | style="text-align: center"| [[1998 in film|1998]]
([[71st Academy Awards|71st]]) | Gary Tregaskis | Computer software | {{won}} | Gary Tregaskis, for the primary design; Dominique Boisvert, Phillip Panzini, Andre LeBlanc for the development and implementation of the Flame and Inferno software. | style="text-align: center"| {{cite web|url=http://www.oscars.org/sci-tech/ceremonies/1999|title=The 71st Scientific and Technical Awards (1998)|publisher=Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS)|accessdate=26 January 2017}} |- | [[2001 in film|2001]]
([[74th Academy Awards|74th]]) |Bruce Tulloch Norman Jackson Andrew Brent John Lancken |Development of Digital Audio Dubbing equipment (Fairlight DaD) for film audio dubbing and mixing. | {{won}} |Bruce Tulloch and Norman Jackson developed a technology used by film dubbing engineers to mix film soundtracks. Emilijo Mihatov was Product Manager, Andrew Brent was technical support and John Lancken was market development. The product was manufactured by Fairlight ESP Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia. | |- | style="text-align: center"| [[2003 in film|2003]]
([[76th Academy Awards|76th]]) | Michael Carlos
Andrew Cannon
Christopher Alfred | Digital audio editing for motion picture post-production | {{won}} | Michael Carlos, Andrew Cannon, and Christopher Alfred developed the technology at [[Fairlight (company)|Fairlight ESP Pty Ltd]], Sydney, Australia. | style="text-align: center"| {{cite web|url=http://www.oscars.org/sci-tech/ceremonies/2004|title=The 76th Scientific and Technical Awards (2003)|publisher=Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS)|accessdate=26 January 2017}} |- | style="text-align: center"| [[2010 in film|2010]]
([[83rd Academy Awards|83rd]]) | Tony Clark
Alan Rogers
Neil Wilson
Rory McGregor | Software design and continued development of cineSync, a tool for remote collaboration and review of visual effects | {{won}} | | style="text-align: center"| {{cite web|url=http://www.oscars.org/sci-tech/ceremonies/2011|title=The 83rd Scientific and Technical Awards (2010)|publisher=Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS)|accessdate=26 January 2017}} |} ==See also== {{Portal|Australia}} * [[Cinema of Australia]] * [[List of Australian submissions for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.oscars.org/ The official website of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS)] ;Further reading *[https://www.screenaustralia.gov.au/australian-success/academy-awards-nominations-and-awards Academy Awards® Nominations and Awards for Australian projects and people] at [[Screen Australia]] *[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/02/20/1234633067981.html?page=fullpage#contentSwap1 O stands for Oscar and also for Oz] at ''[[The Age]]'' {{Academy Awards lists}} [[Category:Cinema of Australia|Academy Awards]] [[Category:Lists of Australian media|Academy Awards]] [[Category:Academy Award winners and nominees by nationality or region|Australian]]

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Playboy'' models}} This is a list of all the [[model (person)|model]]s photographed for ''[[Playboy]]'' magazine. Not all of the women who have modeled in ''Playboy'' have done so in the nude.
The list has been split up into several articles by decade of publication. Please see the following articles for names and date of appearance:
*[[List of people in Playboy 1953–1959|List of people in ''Playboy'' 1953–1959]] *[[List of people in Playboy 1960–1969|List of people in ''Playboy'' 1960–1969]] *[[List of people in Playboy 1970–1979|List of people in ''Playboy'' 1970–1979]] *[[List of people in Playboy 1980–1989|List of people in ''Playboy'' 1980–1989]] *[[List of people in Playboy 1990–1999|List of people in ''Playboy'' 1990–1999]] *[[List of people in Playboy 2000–2009|List of people in ''Playboy'' 2000–2009]] *[[List of people in Playboy 2010–2019|List of people in ''Playboy'' 2010–2019]]
==See also== *[[Playboy Playmate]]
==External links== *[http://www.playboywiki.com/ Playboy Wiki]
<!-- do not add "Category:Playboy" because "Category:Playboy lists" is a subcat -->
[[Category:Playboy lists]] [[Category:Lists of entertainers|Playboy models]] [[Category:Lists of female models|Playboy]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox dot-com company | name = Mango TV | logo = Mango_TV_logo.jpg | screenshot = Hunantvcom.png | founded = {{start date and age|df=yes|2006|05|26}} | location = [[Changsha, Hunan]] | country = [[China]] | chairman = Zhang Yong | CEO = Cai Huaijun | industry = [[New media]] | products = Mango Hi Q (OEM by HiMedia) | website = {{URL|mgtv.com}} | language = Simplified Chinese | current status = Online }} '''Mango TV''' (芒果TV, ''Mángguǒ TV'') is a Chinese Internet enterprise operated by [http://mgtv.com mgtv.com] Corporation.<ref>{{cite web|title=About Us_mgtv.com|url=http://corp.mgtv.com/en/about/#1st|website=mgtv.com|accessdate=15 October 2016}}</ref> Mango TV was established on May 26, 2006 in [[Changsha]], [[Hunan Province|Hunan]] and later decided to use 'Mango TV(Internet TV, PC, Phone and Pad)' as its video platform branding title in 2008.<ref>{{cite web|title=公司信息_湖南快乐阳光互动娱乐传媒有限公司(About Us_mgtv)|url=http://corp.mgtv.com/about/#1st|website=Mango TV|accessdate=15 October 2016}}</ref> Mango TV specializes in creating online videos and is an online platform providing all of the content that is presented in TV channels, and all other copyright works from [[Hunan Broadcasting System]] and [[Hunan Television|Hunan Satellite TV]]. Its current headquarter is located in Golden Eagle Movie&TV Cultural City, Changsha, Hunan, China. Mango TV provides audience with all kinds of content including [[films]], [[TV series]], [[music]], [[cartoons]] and [[entertainment]].
On April 31, 2016, Mango TV was reported to have 39 million [[daily active users]] on its website, with the content from Hunan Satellite TV only accounting for 38% in all that Mango TV has produced.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wang|first1=Xiaoyi|title=芒果TV：出资超一亿 做内容孵化平台_网易财经|url=http://money.163.com/16/0505/18/BMAQ5L6N00253B0H.html|accessdate=22 October 2016|publisher=21jingji.com}}</ref>
On May 9, 2018, the license which Hunan Broadcasting System got to broadcast the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] was taken away after it was revealed that Mango TV, which broadcast Eurovision 2018 for Chinese audiences, censored the Albanian and Irish performances, along with censoring any [[Rainbow flag (LGBT movement)|rainbow flags]] which were seen in the audience.
== History ==
Mango TV was established on May 26, 2006, in Changsha, Hunan by Ruobo Zhang, the former Mango TV Chairman&CEO.<ref>{{cite web|title=芒果TV_创业公司_新芽(Mango TV_startup_newseed)|url=http://newseed.pedaily.cn/company/37559|website=newseed|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=张若波 湖南快乐阳光互动娱乐传媒有限公司CEO_经济频道_央视网(cctv.com)|url=http://jingji.cntv.cn/2014/05/14/ARTI1400048903474143.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=jingji.cntv.cn}}</ref> On April 20, 2014, the original Mango TV and Golden Eagle website were integrated into a single online video platform which exclusively holds all of Hunan Broadcasting System and Hunan Satellite TV's content and enjoys their copyright works, also known as "Mango Exclusive Broadcast".<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Cao|first1=Jie|title=芒果TV的独播战略(Mango Exclusive Broadcast)_|journal=Baidu Wenku|url=http://wenku.baidu.com/view/7ad1dea8783e0912a3162ac1.html?from=search|accessdate=15 October 2016}}</ref> In October 2014, Mango TV created the first self-produced [[web series]] 'Huayang Jianghu'.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Zhang|first1=Chun|title=芒果TV打造马栏山出品 自制剧《花样江湖》(Mango TV produced the first network drama 'Huayang Jianghu)|url=http://ent.news.cn/2014-08/07/c_126843542.htm|publisher=Xinhua Net|accessdate=15 October 2016}}</ref> On 2014 New Year Countdown Night, held by Hunan Satellite TV, Mango TV launched '''five-screen''' live broadcast mode, allowing audience to select different camera positions and angles to watch the celebration show.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Zhang|first1=Zhen|title=芒果TV创新网台互动模式 多屏全景直播小年夜春晚|url=http://news.sina.com.cn/o/2015-02-12/170831514361.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|publisher=Rednet.com}}</ref>
In 2015, Mango TV has experienced a shift from 'Exclusive Broadcast' to 'Unique Content',{{explain|date=December 2016}} during which period the number of users has increased to 60 million on the platform.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Yang|first1=Lei|title=丁诚+芒果tv 除了独播，还有什么？|journal=Economic Weekly|url=http://finance.sina.com.cn/2015-12-24/doc-ifxmxxsp6860249.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> In October 2015, Mango TV built collaboration and signed a memorandum with BBC World, seeking for more opportunities on co-production in the global market.<ref>{{cite news|title=BBC Worldwide, China's Mango TV to Explore Co-Productions|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/bbc-worldwide-chinas-mango-tv-831283|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref>
== Content == === Mango TV originals === Mango TV originals refers to work or content that are produced by Mango TV itself, compared to a large proportion of content that it exclusively broadcasts from Hunan Satellite TV. ==== Drama ==== In October 2014, Mango TV's first self-produced network drama 'Huayang Jianghu' debuted, which featured ancient Chinese world as well as costumes and starred young idols.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果TV首部定制剧《花样江湖》顺利杀青(图)-新华网|url=http://ent.news.cn/2014-08/21/c_126900028.htm|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=ent.news.cn}}</ref> In late 2014, Mango TV produced the second drama 'Jinpai Hongniang'. The drama featured fixed cast compared to previous network dramas which preferred to take each episode with different actors.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果TV电影级标准拍网剧 《金牌红娘》破千万_网易娱乐|url=http://ent.163.com/14/1104/17/AA7MPVAS00031GVS.html|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=ent.163.com}}</ref> ==== Network show ==== In 2015, Mango TV produced the first interactive network live show 'Perfect Holiday', featuring normal young participants living in the same house.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果TV粉丝经济《完美假期》成网生综艺标杆_厂商动态-中关村在线(Mango TV's fans economy: Perfect Holiday)|url=http://news.zol.com.cn/550/5509826.html|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=news.zol.com.cn}}</ref> The production used multi-positioned cameras which enabled audience to watch the show with different angles of rooms. Later in July 2016, 'Perfect Holiday 2' debuted with more rooms in different themes. It added new [[IP camera|IP cameras]] that would follow the participants all the time, which increased the sense of entertainment.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果TV《完美假期2》开播 内容营销全面升级备受瞩目('Perfect Holiday' debuted, making progress on content marketing)|url=http://ent.ifeng.com/a/20160718/42653374_0.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=ent.ifeng.com}}</ref>
Later in 2015, Mango TV introduced '[[the Million Second Quiz]]' from [[NBC]], hosted by [[Kevin Tsai]]. Keeping the main sections of the show, Mango TV added new online interactive Q&A section.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果巨制《百万秒问答》启动 蔡康永主持|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/z/v/2015-09-07/doc-ifxhqtsx3595225.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=ent.sina.com}}</ref>
In 2016, sponsored exclusively by [[JD.com]], Mango TV produced 'Crime Scene'. It is originated from Korea show and featured content in both thrill and humor.<ref>{{cite news|title=京东金融携手芒果TV《明星大侦探》开启战略合作第一步_滚动播报_光明网|url=http://e.gmw.cn/2016-06/17/content_20592515.htm|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=e.gmw.cn}}</ref>
=== Hunan satellite TV === With 'Mango Exclusive Broadcast', Mango TV provides all the content from Hunan Satellite TV exclusively. Some of the notable shows are as follow:
*''[[Happy Camp (variety show)|Happy Camp]]'' *''[[Day Day Up]]'' *''[[Super Girl (TV series)|Super Girl]]'' *''[[Super Boy (TV series)|Super Boy]]'' *''[[Where Are We Going, Dad? (TV series)|Where Are We Going, Dad?]]'' *''[[I Am a Singer (Chinese TV series)|I Am a Singer]]''
== Product == === Mango Hi Q === Mango Hi Q is a HD IPTV [[set-top box]](STB) which enables users to request TV programs, movies, music and games.
Users can enjoy all the copyright works of Hunan Satellite TV and Mango TV provided by the box.<ref>{{cite news|title=真我个性年轻优选 芒果TV定制款芒果嗨Q H5重磅上市_网易数码|url=http://digi.163.com/16/0913/13/C0RJF0ET001680NS.html|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=digi.163.com}}</ref> Also, they can use Mobile App [[Wechat]] to search video content and watch it on their television. == Financing == On June 23, 2016, Mango TV has completed series B funding with nearly 1.5 billion.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果TV宣布完成近15亿元B轮融资|url=http://finance.sina.com.cn/roll/2016-06-23/doc-ifxtmwri4314182.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=finance.sina.com.cn}}</ref>
Its estimated value now is 13.5 billion and was planning to [[go public]] in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=估值近135亿元 芒果TV为何放弃单独上市|url=http://tech.ifeng.com/a/20160906/44447982_0.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=tech.ifeng.com}}</ref> But the plan failed and Mango TV ended up in being included into Happigo Home Shopping Co. Ltd, going public with other six companies.<ref>{{cite news|title=芒果TV独立上市流产背后：湖南卫视综艺节目难再一家独大|url=http://www.techweb.com.cn/finance/2016-09-07/2388026.shtml|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=techweb.com.cn}}</ref>
Critics stated that it would be better for Mango TV to obtain fully controlled operating authority. With Hunan Broadcasting System owning more than 50% shares, it's hard for Mango TV to make decisions all by itself.<ref>{{cite news|title=调令芒果TV借壳上市，湖南广电还要绝对控股多久？_网易财经|url=http://money.163.com/16/0823/10/BV587SK7002580S6.html|accessdate=22 October 2016|work=money.163.com}}</ref>
== Homophobic controversy ==
In May 2018, during the Eurovision's performance of [[Ireland in the Eurovision Song Contest 2018|Irish singers]], Mango TV allegedly blurred and censored gay love symbols such as a kiss and [[Rainbow flag (LGBT movement)|LGBT flags]], resulting in the Eurovision administration ending contract with the Chinese TV channel.<ref>{{cite news |title=Eurovision 2018: Chinese channel barred from airing contest|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-44078305 |work=BBC}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{official|http://www.mgtv.com }} * [http://corp.mgtv.com/en/ Mango TV Corporation(English Version)]
